This issue clones THEAPP-1688

items.fromString: Pikachu
Stromberg
VICI

h2. Customer Problem and Value

*Customer Problem*

_n/a_

*Customer / Business Value*

We currently have multiple ideas for a Wallet Integration in the pipeline
 * Mobile Device Key (like a Wallet Card)
 * Porsche Charging Card 
 * Porsche Event Tickets
 * Porsche Lounge Passes

All this Wallet objects must be signed with the My Porsche Apps certificate and should be treated as a "View" of our app.

To enable all those use cases and more, we need a shared service which is taking care of everything wallet related. 

This helps us scaling, since not every domain team has to have a deep knowledge to the "Wallet capabilities" and we can securely store sensitive assets, like the signing certificate, at a single point.
h2. Solution

_Describe the solution how your product or service solves the stated customer problem_

*User Journey/Design Concept (Support by UX/DX + Template)*
_n/a_

*Technical Solution Concept (optional, support by System Architect)*

_The final solution concept is not yet clear. This PoC is for learning more about the technical challenges and to create a first detailed solution concept._
h2. Benefit Hypothesis

We believe that a shared wallet service will result in a scaling system, which meets also all our security needs. 
h2. Strategic Themes
 - -Charging just happens-

 - -Connect simply works fine-

 - -Porsche offers me an inspiring and simple omni-channel buying experience-

 - -Porsche makes my car better over its entire life-

 - *Porsche offers me an exiting digital ownership experience*

h2. Acceptance Criteria
 * we have a concept on "how-to handle wallet objects" in future within the Porsche App Framework / My Porsche App
 ** the concept considers all markets and regions. There is no exception! The same implementation has to work in China!
 ** the concepts considers iOS and Android
 ** the concepts considers Smartphones & Smartwatches
 * this concept is documented in Confluence and form of Feature(s) in our backlog.
 ** the Feature(s) are "ready for development" (has gone through the Discovery Workshop / Funnel Process)

h2. Availability (Market and Vehicles)

_all markets_
h2. Weighted Shortest Job First

*Time criticality*
 * this feature and the followup feature should be done before the Mobile Device Key can be finally developed / shipped
 * this is also true for the other use-cases, but those have not yet a clear delivery date

*Opportunity Enablement*
 * it enables all the listed use-cases and future once

*Risk Reduction*
 * without a centrally handled "pass signature", we would need to provide the signing certificate to all the domain teams. This would have a high risk, that those certificates are not treated securely.
 * by providing a shared service, a *center of competence* for "everything with Wallet", we avoid that each domain teams have "develop without support". This would lead to higher effort in each team and probably incompatible and incorrect implementations

h2. Contact Person and Dependencies to other Features/Systems/3rd parties?
 * [~P330558] (overarching)
 * [~P377553] (iOS)
 * [~P375088] (Android)

h2. Out of Scope
 * implementing a production grade system
items.toString:
h2. Customer Problem and Value

*Customer Problem*

_n/a_

*Customer / Business Value*

We currently have an implementation for an "Opt-in" and downloading an Apple Pass into the Apple Wallet in the alpha version of the App.

For the Go-live of the Porsche Lounges, we need to continue the integration inside the App and make this feature production-ready. 
 * Integrate the productive new MVP Azure backend URLs
 * Fix Typos
 * Internationalization 
 * Integrate with a Porsche Design guidelines the Lounge view
 * integrate an App ART Pass Signature service which takes care of everything Wallet related

This helps us to be able to go-live with the Authentication backend for the Porsche Lounges, such that the customers can get the entry permissions and start using the lounges once they have been built.

 

_Describe the solution how your product or service solves the stated customer problem_

*User Journey/Design Concept (Support by UX/DX + Template)*
_n/a_

*Technical Solution Concept (optional, support by System Architect)*

_The final solution concept is not yet clear. This PoC is for learning more about the technical challenges and to create a first detailed solution concept._
h2. Benefit Hypothesis

 - -Porsche makes my car better over its entire life-

 - *Porsche offers me an exiting digital ownership experience*

 ** the concept considers all markets and regions. There is no exception! The same implementation has to work in China!
 ** the concepts considers iOS

h2. Availability (Market and Vehicles)

_all markets_
h2. Weighted Shortest Job First

*Time criticality*

*Opportunity Enablement*

*Risk Reduction*

items.fromString:
h2. Customer Problem and Value

*Customer Problem* 

Bug fixes and release are currently slowed down by the huge domain of team Bond, like that the customer doesn't get value as early as he expects it.

*Customer / Business Value*

Quicker Releases and Bug Fixes for the customer. 

h2. Solution

Slice the teams domains to similar size and meaningful such that the best customer experience can be provided

*User Journey/Design Concept (Support by UX/DX + Template)*
See domain Slice Screenshot from Miro attached.

Both teams spare some capacity during the PI to have the possibility to have pair programming or common QA sessions to gain a learning on the other teams domain. The idea is learning on the job rather than have an overall introduction session to the feature and afterwards everything should be clear. 
In the future the team which took over the domain is the team which will be approached for any further development of the domain.

h2. Benefit Hypothesis

We believe that slicing the domains meaningful and smaller will result in speeding up the release testing of Team Bond from currently 2 days to 1.5 days.

h2. Strategic Themes

_Does this feature support any strategic theme?_

 - "Connect simply works fine"

h2. Acceptance Criteria

* Team Stromberg is able to tackle upcoming bugs and release tests for the following domain parts
** Car Finder (Location of Vehicle on Map, Reverse Geocoding of vehicle Location Function Tab): Scope Vodafone and MBB/ODP vehicles
** Last mile navigation (Intend to several routing apps for pedestrian navigation)
** Handling of Special Cases (No license, no remote access, privacy mode) for handed over domain
** Handling of analytics, Happiness Events for handed over domain

* Team Bond is able to tackle upcoming bugs and release tests for the following domain parts
** Intelligent Climatization (Top Tab for PHEV and BEV vehicles): 
** Handling of Special Cases (No license, no remote access, privacy mode) for handed over domain
** Handling of analytics, Happiness Events for handed over domain

h2. Availability (Market and Vehicles)

Car Finder -> All Markets
Last Mile Navigation -> All Markets
Intelligent Climate -> 

h2. Weighted Shortest Job First

*Time criticality*
The faster this handover is conducted the faster the teams can create quicker roll out of bugs and releases to the customer.

*Opportunity Enablement*

Teams have a clear ownership of a domain, which make discovery workshops possible with less sessions of many teams.

*Risk Reduction*

Bugs can be fixed quicker

h2. Out of Scope



*Open Questions*


*Action items*

h2. Customer Problem and Value

*Customer Problem*

_Describe in detail the *ONE* customer problem you want to solve._

*Customer / Business Value*

_Describe the value of the Feature from the user's point of view. *Value* is clear for every main functionalities of the feature to allow alternative solutions and slicing to proper size._

Chinese customers can view and share their report and achievements by scanning the QR code within the HCP3 vehicle. __ 
h2. Solution

_Describe the solution how your product or service solves the stated customer problem_

*User Journey/Design Concept (Support by UX/DX + Template)*
_Sketch the complete user journey or a design concept (e.g Powerpoint, Video, Paint, Abstract...). Ideally have personas in mind and think of all users incl. dealers._

*Technical Solution Concept (optional, support by System Architect)*

_Sketch the technical solution concept. If available, include information about 3rd party service providers and impact on capability map._ Is local client logic required or does the API handle every scenario? Can specific data be cached? How long?
h2. Benefit Hypothesis

_Defines the proposed measurable benefit to the user or business. Avoid no brainer like "increase relevance" or "add value", because everything we do should meet these criteria. Don‘t repeat the problem statement in other words. Think about a proper measurement._

We believe that [doing this] will result in [this outcome / behavior]. > Qualitative hypothesis

We are right if/We will know this to be true when we see [this feedback, quantitative measure, qualitative insight] > Quantitative hypothesis (KPIs)
h2. Strategic Themes

_Does this feature support any strategic theme?_
_*Bold* the relevant strategic themes this feature contributes to:_
 - Charging just happens

 - *Connect simply works fine*

 - Porsche offers me an inspiring and simple omni-channel buying experience

 - Porsche makes my car better over its entire life

 - Porsche offers me an exiting digital ownership experience

h2. Acceptance Criteria

_Main points which describe when the feature would be fulfilled incl. happy cases, unhappy cases (error, no connection, fallback, etc.), edge cases, alternative modes (privacy, theft, license). Hint: AC's are no ToDo's_

_Acceptance criteria are testable in the form of:_
_[User] can/sees/has ... (e.g. User can set a temperature between 16°C and 29 °C when he starts climate control)_
h2. Availability (Market and Vehicles)

_Is this feature limited in its availability for markets/account types/impacted vehicle models with attributes (PR numbers, service IDs, etc.)?_

China
h2. Weighted Shortest Job First

*Time criticality*
_Is there already a known timeline (e.g. presented in VAP, VAD, DK,...)? Are there any timely constraints? Is it related to any Vehicle Release? Describe what happens if we didn't make the Feature happen until XYZ. E.g. if delivering 1-3 months later, we cant deliver vehicle "xyz" or it will cause a drop of "y" sales._

*Opportunity Enablement*

_What else does this do for our business? Will this feature enable new business opportunities?_

*Risk Reduction*

_Does this feature reduce any risk of this or a future delivery?_
h2. Contact Person and Dependencies to other Features/Systems/3rd parties?

_Describe any known dependency, e.g. Feature (JIRA LINK) has to be done first. What is necessary to implement that feature within the App (e.g. Documentation on required APIs and the authentication, Example Payload, )? Are you depending on some deliveries from other departments or service providers? Is there any special availability requirements on Hardware- , Software- or Supportlevel to mention here? Who is the contact point (Department, Team,...) of a third party? Are there any known edge or special cases for which the development teams can resolve a solution._

_FO_
h2. Out of Scope

_Define what is NOT part of this feature and might be covered in other features. Optional link to further / follow up features._
h2. Next steps

*Open Questions*

_e.g. questions that came up during the Discovery WS and have to be answered before feature is ready for development._

*Action items*

_List of to-dos to be fulfilled to get the feature ready for dev. Please use the "@" in front of each question/todo/action-item to clearly define the responsibility._

h2. Customer Problem and Value

*Customer Problem*

_Describe in detail the *ONE* customer problem you want to solve._

Chinese customers can federate 3rd party accounts and PID (e.g. WeChat) together within the vehicle HCP3, but not by using the smart phone,. __ 

*Customer / Business Value*

_Describe the value of the Feature from the user's point of view. *Value* is clear for every main functionalities of the feature to allow alternative solutions and slicing to proper size._
h2. Solution

_Describe the solution how your product or service solves the stated customer problem_

*User Journey/Design Concept (Support by UX/DX + Template)*
_Sketch the complete user journey or a design concept (e.g Powerpoint, Video, Paint, Abstract...). Ideally have personas in mind and think of all users incl. dealers._

*Technical Solution Concept (optional, support by System Architect)*

_Sketch the technical solution concept. If available, include information about 3rd party service providers and impact on capability map._ Is local client logic required or does the API handle every scenario? Can specific data be cached? How long?
h2. Benefit Hypothesis

_Defines the proposed measurable benefit to the user or business. Avoid no brainer like "increase relevance" or "add value", because everything we do should meet these criteria. Don‘t repeat the problem statement in other words. Think about a proper measurement._

We believe that [doing this] will result in [this outcome / behavior]. > Qualitative hypothesis

We are right if/We will know this to be true when we see [this feedback, quantitative measure, qualitative insight] > Quantitative hypothesis (KPIs)
h2. Strategic Themes

_Does this feature support any strategic theme?_
_*Bold* the relevant strategic themes this feature contributes to:_
 - Charging just happens

 - *Connect simply works fine*

 - Porsche offers me an inspiring and simple omni-channel buying experience

 - Porsche makes my car better over its entire life

 - Porsche offers me an exiting digital ownership experience

h2. Acceptance Criteria

_Main points which describe when the feature would be fulfilled incl. happy cases, unhappy cases (error, no connection, fallback, etc.), edge cases, alternative modes (privacy, theft, license). Hint: AC's are no ToDo's_

_Acceptance criteria are testable in the form of:_
_[User] can/sees/has ... (e.g. User can set a temperature between 16°C and 29 °C when he starts climate control)_
h2. Availability (Market and Vehicles)

_Is this feature limited in its availability for markets/account types/impacted vehicle models with attributes (PR numbers, service IDs, etc.)?_

China
h2. Weighted Shortest Job First

*Time criticality*
_Is there already a known timeline (e.g. presented in VAP, VAD, DK,...)? Are there any timely constraints? Is it related to any Vehicle Release? Describe what happens if we didn't make the Feature happen until XYZ. E.g. if delivering 1-3 months later, we cant deliver vehicle "xyz" or it will cause a drop of "y" sales._

*Opportunity Enablement*

_What else does this do for our business? Will this feature enable new business opportunities?_

*Risk Reduction*

_Does this feature reduce any risk of this or a future delivery?_

Who is the contact point (Department, Team,...) of a third party? Are there any known edge or special cases for which the development teams can resolve a solution._
h2. Out of Scope

_Define what is NOT part of this feature and might be covered in other features. Optional link to further / follow up features._

 * [~xuguangyin] Estimation of the feature

h2. Customer Problem and Value

*Customer Problem*

_Describe in detail the *ONE* customer problem you want to solve._

*Customer / Business Value*

_Describe the value of the Feature from the user's point of view. *Value* is clear for every main functionalities of the feature to allow alternative solutions and slicing to proper size._
h2. Solution

_Describe the solution how your product or service solves the stated customer problem_

*User Journey/Design Concept (Support by UX/DX + Template)*
_Sketch the complete user journey or a design concept (e.g Powerpoint, Video, Paint, Abstract...). Ideally have personas in mind and think of all users incl. dealers._

*Technical Solution Concept (optional, support by System Architect)*

_Sketch the technical solution concept. If available, include information about 3rd party service providers and impact on capability map._ Is local client logic required or does the API handle every scenario? Can specific data be cached? How long?
h2. Benefit Hypothesis

_Defines the proposed measurable benefit to the user or business. Avoid no brainer like "increase relevance" or "add value", because everything we do should meet these criteria. Don‘t repeat the problem statement in other words. Think about a proper measurement._

We believe that [doing this] will result in [this outcome / behavior]. > Qualitative hypothesis

We are right if/We will know this to be true when we see [this feedback, quantitative measure, qualitative insight] > Quantitative hypothesis (KPIs)
h2. Strategic Themes

_Does this feature support any strategic theme?_
_*Bold* the relevant strategic themes this feature contributes to:_
 - Charging just happens

 - Connect simply works fine

 - Porsche offers me an inspiring and simple omni-channel buying experience

 - Porsche makes my car better over its entire life

 - Porsche offers me an exiting digital ownership experience

h2. Acceptance Criteria

_Main points which describe when the feature would be fulfilled incl. happy cases, unhappy cases (error, no connection, fallback, etc.), edge cases, alternative modes (privacy, theft, license). Hint: AC's are no ToDo's_

_Acceptance criteria are testable in the form of:_
_[User] can/sees/has ... (e.g. User can set a temperature between 16°C and 29 °C when he starts climate control)_

_Is this feature limited in its availability for markets/account types/impacted vehicle models with attributes (PR numbers, service IDs, etc.)?_

_Defines the proposed measurable benefit to the user or business. Avoid no brainer like "increase relevance" or "add value", because everything we do should meet these criteria. Don‘t repeat the problem statement in other words. Think about a proper measurement._
